pullRequest.title: Jstor Fetcher
pullRequest.bodyText:
added Fetcher for jstor.org
Fixes #6627

 Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)
 Tests created for changes (if applicable)
 Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)
 Screenshots added in PR description (for UI changes)
 Checked documentation: Is the information available and up to date? If not created an issue at https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues or, even better, submitted a pull request to the documentation repository.

commit.message:
Started implementing Parser for jstor.org
Fixes #6627

nodes.bodyText:
Something is odd with your import order. Did you import the JabRef code style for Intellij?
https://devdocs.jabref.org/getting-into-the-code/guidelines-for-setting-up-a-local-workspace#using-jabrefs-code-style

commit.message: added fulltext search for Jstor Fetcher
refactor fulltext search for jstor and add test case

nodes.bodyText: I don't know why our AUTHORS checker complains here. Maybe because of some whitespace. I can take care after the merge
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -179,6 +179,7 @@ Jens Döcke
 joeyzgraggen

nodes.bodyText: Why can't you use the method directly reading from the input stream? https://jsoup.org/apidocs/org/jsoup/Jsoup.html#parse(java.io.InputStream,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
There is no need to instantiate the parser for each parse run. Please instantiate before the loop

commit.message: add support for ComplexSearch to JstorFetcher
